title: 112_s3593
content: The Act titled "Improving Services and Activities for Diverse Elders Act" aims to amend the Older Americans Act of 1965 to include culturally and linguistically competent services and supports for diverse elders. The Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to include cultural and linguistic competence, defined as behaviors, attitudes, and policies enabling effective work in cross-cultural situations. The Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to include cultural and linguistic competence in serving older individuals. Amendments include updating definitions in various paragraphs and a conforming amendment to Section 373(c)(1)(B). Section 202(a) of the Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to provide technical assistance, training, and instruction to entities for developing and implementing culturally and linguistically competent programming for older individuals with economic and social needs, focusing on low-income minority individuals and those in rural areas. Additionally, consultation with national and community-based organizations representing minority individuals is required to enhance the Administration's capacity in providing such assistance. SEC. 5. ORGANIZATION. Amends Section 305(a)(2)(C) of the Older Americans Act to include the distribution of service providers specializing in serving older individuals with greatest social need among planning and service areas. SEC. 6. AREA PLANS. Section 306(a) of the Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to include provisions for culturally and linguistically competent programming, services, and outreach for older individuals with greatest social need. Staff training must include instruction on cultural and linguistic competence, and services provided by contractors must also be culturally and linguistically competent. The Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to include provisions for culturally and linguistically competent services for older individuals with greatest social need, ensuring services are provided in a culturally and linguistically competent manner. SEC. 7. STATE PLANS. Section 307(a) of the Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to ensure culturally and linguistically competent programming and services for older individuals with greatest social need, including the requirement for workers fluent in the language spoken by limited English proficient individuals.
